channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Abortion can be difficult to talk about. These 14 strangers took it on anyway
item.description: Over three days, 14 people with different backgrounds from all over Wisconsin met in person to discuss abortion policy and discovered how far they could get.
item.content:encoded:
Over three days, 14 people with different backgrounds from all over Wisconsin met in person to discuss abortion policy and discovered how far they could get.

(Image credit: Maayan Silver)
item.dc:creator: Maayan Silver

item.title: Caleb Carr, author of 'The Alienist', dies at 68
item.description: The New York-based author's books explored the origins of violence.
item.content:encoded:
The New York-based author's books explored the origins of violence.

(Image credit: Courtesy Caleb Carr)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: What we know and what we don't about a historic settlement to pay college athletes
item.description: The proposed legal settlement by the NCAA and its Power Five conferences would allow schools to directly pay athletes. But questions remain, including whether men and women will be paid equally.
item.content:encoded:
The proposed legal settlement by the NCAA and its Power Five conferences would allow schools to directly pay athletes. But questions remain, including whether men and women will be paid equally.

(Image credit: Ezra Shaw)
item.dc:creator: Becky Sullivan

item.title: New malaria vaccine delivered for the first time
item.description: The Central African Republic is the first country to receive thousands of doses of a new malaria vaccine recommended by the World Health Organization last October.
item.content:encoded:
The Central African Republic is the first country to receive thousands of doses of a new malaria vaccine recommended by the World Health Organization last October.

(Image credit: Yasuyoshi Chiba)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Iranians React President's Death; North Korean Propaganda Goes Viral
item.description:
Iran laid the body of President Ebrahim Raisi to rest, after he died in a helicopter crash. Though thousands attended funeral ceremonies, we hear from Iranians who say he won't be remembered fondly.

And in South Korea, a propaganda video from North Korea is banned after it goes viral on TikTok.
item.content:encoded:
Iran laid the body of President Ebrahim Raisi to rest, after he died in a helicopter crash. Though thousands attended funeral ceremonies, we hear from Iranians who say he won't be remembered fondly.

And in South Korea, a propaganda video from North Korea is banned after it goes viral on TikTok.
item.dc:creator: Peter Kenyon

item.title: Negotiators for the global pandemic treaty couldn't meet their deadline
item.description: The World Health Organization hoped to have a treaty ready for ratification at its assembly next week. On Friday, WHO leader Tedros said negotiators couldn't resolve all the sticking points in time.
item.content:encoded:
The World Health Organization hoped to have a treaty ready for ratification at its assembly next week. On Friday, WHO leader Tedros said negotiators couldn't resolve all the sticking points in time.

(Image credit: Francois Lo Presti)
item.dc:creator: Gabrielle Emanuel

item.title: The Shiba Inu that inspired Dogecoin crypto and countless memes has died
item.description: Much sad. Kabosu, the Shiba Inu whose side-eyed look inspired countless memes, died on Friday, her owner said.
item.content:encoded:
Much sad. Kabosu, the Shiba Inu whose side-eyed look inspired countless memes, died on Friday, her owner said.

(Image credit: Philip Fong)
item.dc:creator: Emma Bowman

item.title: The top U.N. court has ordered Israel to stop its Rafah military operation
item.description: The International Court of Justice in The Hague has no power to enforce Friday's ruling, but it adds international pressure on Israel.
item.content:encoded:
The International Court of Justice in The Hague has no power to enforce Friday's ruling, but it adds international pressure on Israel.

(Image credit: Peter Dejong)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: Morgan Spurlock, documentary filmmaker of 'Super Size Me', dies at 53
item.description: In his inventive 2004 documentary about the fast food industry, Spurlock consumed only McDonald’s fast food for a month. He died Thursday from complications of cancer.
item.content:encoded:
In his inventive 2004 documentary about the fast food industry, Spurlock consumed only McDonald’s fast food for a month. He died Thursday from complications of cancer.

(Image credit: Neilson Barnard)
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: DOJ sues Ticketmaster and Live Nation; the dangers of sharing kids' photos online
item.description: The Justice Department is suing Ticketmaster and its owner, Live Nation, accusing it of being a monopoly. And, here's why you should think twice before posting a photo of your kid online.
item.content:encoded:
The Justice Department is suing Ticketmaster and its owner, Live Nation, accusing it of being a monopoly. And, here's why you should think twice before posting a photo of your kid online.

(Image credit: Drew Angerer)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen
